Reviews.Title: I bought this phone for a developmentaly disabled person
Reviews.Author: Liam M Mullen
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for a developmentaly disabled person. Great, simple to use, phone. When I brought it into T-Mobile to get a simcard for it, the staff passed it around commented on how easy it was to understand how to use. The numbers on this phone are really big. The SOS button on the back is a great feature that can be programed to dial 911 and send Text to additional phone number.

Reviews.Title: wonderful
Reviews.Author: stephen train
Reviews.Content: for someone who does not want a teeny tiny phone in their hand this phone is great.  It has nice weight, easy to program and use and very easy to see with.

Reviews.Title: Great easy to use phone
Reviews.Author: Shirley Degan
Reviews.Content: Easy to use phone, love the big keys and large font.  Only problem:  does not have voice mail.  Also, if you hold the red button too long it shuts off the phone.  Thought it was broken!!!!

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Mary Marlene Irwin
Reviews.Content: The concept of this big button is enticing. In reality, it is a cheaply made phone with a very limited range of features. In its defense, it is a REALLY LOUD phone. Just not what I had in mind. We returned it, and the cost was refunded promptly.

Reviews.Title: Not 3-G won't work with my ATT Microcell
Reviews.Author: medpat
Reviews.Content: This is a nice phone if you have 3 or more bars of  signal, but with only 2 bars it is very hard for my callers to understand me. I would have liked to known that it wasn't 3-G. BEFORE  I PURCHASED IT.The SOS button doesn't work. The speed dialer does, though. Moot point. I have only one SIM card in the phone, so it keeps asking me to insert a SIM card.It has the ability to work on two networks at once. (two SIM Cards) The charging cord is too short to be practical.It is very difficult to line up to insert. My wife tore off the rubber cover in frustration.I guess a USB extension cord would help.The navigation buttons are hard to use, up down left right.Be careful with the brass battery cover screw, don't drop it.The phonebook is not easy to understand but works well enough.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: mick gokey
Reviews.Content: inexpensive but it seems to be well made will do every thing I need a phone to do. easy to use .

Reviews.Title: It's not bad but not ideal for a senior
Reviews.Author: Isaac
Reviews.Content: The phone still have too many features for a plain phone. I bought it for my elderly aunt who is hard of hearing. With no way to adjust the volume, she can't hear well on it. Also the phone has a keypad lock feature. To unlock it, you have to press the unlock key and the end button very fast.  Usually within a second or so.  It usually takes her 4 or 5 tries to unlock it so she can use it. It's decent and rugged with a big number display and late buttons, but it could do without a few things.

Reviews.Title: Exactly as advertised.
Reviews.Author: Luong Phan
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for my 94 year old Grandma.  Other phones had buttons that were too small for her to use.  This phone was simple enough for her to use. Also GIANT buttons!

Reviews.Title: Not a great choice for seniors
Reviews.Author: Randy P McCracken
Reviews.Content: This is not a great choice for seniors, and I am one. Oh sure, the numbers in the display are large, and so are the numbers on the buttons. But the volume does not go very loud, and is difficult to hear in some situations. The directions are not clear, and forget customer service. I wanted to put a different ring tone on the phone, and can't figure out how to do so. The charging cord is short and cheap. I am stuck with mine, but if you haven't bought one yet, consider STRONGLY others.

Reviews.Title: Not Just For Seniors
Reviews.Author: Happy Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because my loved one is struggling with a sex addiction and has not been able to find a phone through t mobile without web capability. He already has a plan with t mobile so he felt trapped. Now this phone serves all his needs while allowing him to regain self control. These phones do require bigger sim cards than what is normally supplied through t mobile, but they can switch your sim card over to the larger, older style in minutes for a nominal fee at any t mobile store. The charger port on the phone is bigger than your average universal smart phone charger port, but the appropriate charger is supplied with the phone and many adapters still exist out there that would work for this phone. Even though my loved one is not a senior, he has peace of mind managing his restaurant at night with the sos feature and also likes the excellent flashlight feature. All in all, a great purchase for all ages.

Reviews.Title: excelent
Reviews.Author: Roberto
Reviews.Content: good sounds. easy to use.not heavy at all big numbers and letters.Our parents are rally happy whith it

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with the Kevenz km-300 cell phone
Reviews.Author: Michael Fazio
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my 81 year old mother who lives with us and am unable to find any detailed information on how to configure the phone including the SOS button. So far the SOS button just makes a siren sound and never dials the speed dial numbers. This is the second product that I have purchased recently and does not have any detailed information on the kevenz.com website or Google. I am still waiting for help from the manufacturer since amazon.com doesn't have additional information or links.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Monique D.
Reviews.Content: My spouse is thrilled with her cell phone. Big numbers all around. It is big in size and so easy for her to operate. Thanks for making such a neat phone

Reviews.Title: Great for seniors with poor eyesight
Reviews.Author: Alice S. Hoelzer
Reviews.Content: Got this to replace a flip phone that went through the wash (!) for my 90 year old husband.  Nice feel - the ring tone is one he can hear - still in the learning process, but it seems to be doing the job.

ProductInfo.Features:
Elderly Cell Phone each key individually designed, feel very good, fingers stiff elderly very easy to use
Using a special process to manufacture rubber and plastic materials mixed body of the phone, the phone is more robust, will not fall off during use.
Large font cell phone , the elderly poor eyesight is very easy to use
Easy to hear phones, large cell phone with a large speaker on the back, They can hear the speaker phone at a noisy bus stop.
The SOS button on the back is a great feature that can be programed to dial 911 and send Text to additional phone number. Kevenz for making you feel that your Aging Parents and grandmother is safe and secure with this unique piece of technoloy!
ProductInfo.Name: Kevenz Senior Citizen Cell Phone,Big Letters and Big Button,Simple and Easy to Use,SOS Button Phones(Prevent slipping,for over the age of 60 elderly,Unlocked GSM,Brown)
